Posts.Content: I go for my first chemo session today and still haven't decided about the cold cap.  It's interesting to hear you say about the headache as that's my worst concern as I suffer from migraines and worried it will bring one on.  Think I would prefer the hair loss than the migraine and maybe even look forward to my hair growing back differently!! Hope you feel better soon Wendy Dianne
Posts.Title: cold cap???

Posts.Content: I was recently diagnosed with tachycardia of unknown cause and put on beta blockers.  When I went back for a  meds review I saw a different GP who suggested it might be due to having chemo and radiotherapy.  She is going to speak to another GP who has an interest in the heart, but I was wondering if this has happened to anyone else and what treatment you might have had. I just did a google search and wish I hadn't! Thank you
Posts.Title: Tachycardia

Posts.Content: Thanks for that Hiloa, I don't have a follow up appt until April with the cancer team, so will ask them about it then if I don't get any answers from my GP. Hope your husband is ok. Disy
Posts.Title: Tachycardia

Posts.Content: Hi, just wondering where people get hold of head scarves if they don't wear wigs?

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone, I've just ordered some.

Posts.Content: Good luck Sue, I know how you're feeling.  I have an appointment re chemo on Monday.  If they hadn't found cancer in one lymph node I wouldn't have needed the 2nd op and radiotherapy would probably have been over and done with now.
Posts.Title: Scared!!
